column4: Hi, I have a package which is in compress file .tar.gz, how can i install that program! im using ubuntu 10.04 plz help
tar zxvf foo.tar.gz
generqally though, prefer to install software from the repository (software centre I suppose)
umm, mounting an iso takes no diskspace
tar zxvf is used to extract files of install?
yes
*or install?
I want to install the package not extract?
extract it, then look inside there for a README or INSTALL file or something.  They all install differently
but installing from the repository is generally much better
i have wampserver's package
do i need to compile the source code
I thought archive mounter could mount them GUIwise?  That's default installed I believe?
is that a LAMP stack?
yes it is but few softwares are not available under ubuntu software center
its wamp
LAMP is the same thing, but for Linux I believe.  You can install a LAMP stack from the software centre
i went to wamp's website and found that they have a linux package as well... so i downloaded... well, its all ok I ws just keen to know about installing tar.gz like files and got solution i believe.
now I have configured web server manually using apt-get install apache2
sudo tasksel install lamp-server
as easy as that...and you have all the package managed advantages and none of the heartache
